summary: An ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 17956 entitled: "An ordinance providing for the laying off, opening, widening, extending and establishing of Charles Street, from the east line of block 3, Charles' Addition to the City of Seattle, to the west margin of 28th Avenue South, as platted in Hicks Addition to the City of Seattle; and 27th Avenue South and 28th Avenue South, each from the south margin of Dearborn Street to the north margin of Charles Street, all in the City of Seattle,; providing for the condemnation, appropriation, taking and damaging of land and other property necessary therefor and providing that the cost of said improvement shall be paid by special assessment upon the property specially benefited in the manner provided by law" approved February 24, 1908.
